comment_array:
Comment 1: WATCH NEXT: We hear from the team that investigated the culture of no-compromise gun ownership, industry money, and political dysfunction that has made it so difficult to make meaningful change in the US. - https://youtu.be/Py62uYJylRs

Check out more VICE News on VICE TV starting at 10p Thursdays.
Comment 2: Congo's natural mineral potential is valued at $35 trillion, yet is one of the poorest countries in the world. It's crazy.
Comment 3: I'm a Peruvian and I met a congolese person while going through a hard life situation.  He was a smart well spoken person who explained the history and situation of the DRC in a concise manner.  I learned from him.  I have great respect for african people, they are our brothers.  I wish nothing but peace and prosperity for the DRC and Africa in general.
Comment 4: Love Vice News‚Äô return to true frontline reporting that we don‚Äôt see in other media outlets
Comment 5: As a congolese born and raised in Eastern congo, i have seen my fair share of these conflicts and the damage are just unspeakable. First all congratulations to the journalist on giving word to each faction without introducing any bias (and she brave af). Sadly as one comment mentionned before, the only people who are hurt are us. The central government couldn't care less as long as they keep receving the monthly royalties from the exploitation of minerals. For long people have been screaming that the central government left us, but now for their great relief, attention is shifting toward an other enemy (Rwanda, M23) etc.

If we talking peace finally in the east, HOW EXACTLY is it going to come? Because strategically, the burst of violence from time to time is very beneficial to a ruling party (suprise elections are coming by the way). Every fucking body just want his share. Locals are brainwashed into thinking the other is the enemy while billions are being sent everyday to the central government from exploitations of minerals (they are not all illegal). When everything you have in your life is to survive, it is easy to be manipulated. For those of us who were there during the 2000 genocides, what has changed?? Arming locals to go fight a war that should have been handled by the government is you just creating hundreds of militias again once you give them gun. No training, extrememly biased, no control, we are just going from bad to worse. Are we going to fight M23 out? they were out and we wasn't fine exactly. then what happens to those you just gave guns and no plan for reintegration?


Seriously someone answer me because i am just lost
Comment 6: As a Congolese I wish most Congolese realize this war is big part  media and business. We have to wake-up and stop expecting a change if Rwanda leaves. It's all on us to stop corruption, tribalism and selling our country for little money. Every war happening in Congo despite all accusations has a Congolese who opened way,its on us to take responsibility
Comment 7: I'm from Kenya, and I can tell you Kenya's desire to have peace in Congo is genuine. There are tens of thousands of Congolese in kenya (probably more than a hundred thousand), some who came in the late 60s and early 70s, and recently  two years ago, there has been a surge of Congolese youths into Kenya. They are hawking shoes, clothing,  food stuff, and so many working in barbershop across all cities and towns in Kenya. We love them as our brothers and sisters and we wish Congo becomes stable so that most of these young men and women, who appear to be also highly educated to go back home and work as professionals as  trained in schools, colleges and universities. Some are trained high school teachers working as shoes hawkers. Kenyas' interest in the conflict is genuine.
Comment 8: Congo is for the Congolese people... blessings from Jamaica üáØüá≤
Comment 9: More context for why there are Tutsi rebels in the DRC: It's a spillover from the Rwandan Civil War. Basically, Hutu soldiers fled to what was then Zaire after Tutsis won, These soldiers attacked Tutsis in Zaire, Rwanda saw the former Hutu Power officials who wanted to return to power next door as a security threat and wanted them disarmed, Mobutu did nothing as financial support for him stopped after the Cold War ended, Rwanda invaded with other nations to stop the rebels during the First Congo War, Mobutu was toppled, innocent ordinary Hutus fled, and the violence never ended since then. 

DRC has such a tragic history that has left them in this loop of violence and absolute cruelty and inhumanity towards this populace. A real example of legacy and generational trauma being passed down and blunting any type of progress. Europeans buying minerals from Rwanda. Europeans chopping off Congolese hands, limbs and violently exploiting their populace for the country's resources, has left a society of people who know nothing else. The cycle of exploitation, violence and death continues.
Comment 10: These things really just go to show how often we take our peace for granted. Most of us couldn‚Äôt even fathom being born into this life let alone living in it. May god grant the DRC and every other nation facing similar challenges peace.
Comment 11: The language choices by the Congolese players are fascinating as always. 
The people signing up to the militia in Goma speak Swahili, but they call M23 by a French name. French-influenced Swahili has a long history in the region. And, interestingly, it was also spoken by Tutsi fighters who returned to Rwanda in the 90s and defeated the genocidal govt. 
The militia in the field speak something I don't recognise - I assume they're Maimai and it's their local language? Although it could be Kinyarwanda if they're Congolese/Congo-born Hutu?
Kinshasa elites are speaking French, as expected... but so are the M23. You'd think M23 would use English with an anglo journalist, since the Rwandan govt elites who are accused of funding M23 prefer English to French due to complex reasons (eg the french govt supporting the former genocidal regime)... but nope, M23 are using French (EDIT: M23 also use English, Swahili and Kinyrawanda depending on the audience)). 
M23 are talking about the murder of fellow Kinyarwanda speakers in Kinshasa (ie Hutu AND Tutsi)... but not the murder of Tutsi-looking people. They're focusing on the language, not the ethnicity. Meanwhile, Rwanda sits on the sidelines and replies to media in English.

It's all extremely subtle and political - Goma recruiters want a broad local ethnic base so they use the main language of Goma, not their mother tongue. Kinshasa wants to not show a Lingala bias (or Luba, for that matter!) (EDIT: It is very standard for national authorities to use French). The Maimai want to show a strong ethnic identity and the M23 want to avoid showing a Tutsi ethnic identity and instead show that they're Congolese and fit for power in Kinshasa... and while also being mainly concerned for Kinyarwanda speakers (who are ethnic Tutsi). So they speak French, instead of Swahili, English, or Kinyarwanda. And Rwanda? It just wants to be invisible.

If you are confused, that's very normal. It's an extremely complex part of the world. 

(EDIT: Shout out to @ellieallien1464 and others for their useful info in the comments! I'm not interested in looking smart, I'm interested in sharing my modest knowledge about this very important subject :) )

Comment 67: Very interesting and well done here. Sadly, the conflict in DRC, while succinctly explained in many ways in this piece, seems to lack a few details in my opinion. Namely that there's no end in sight until the incentive structures for the conflict change - they keep discussing the same talking points as to their reasons for fighting, and I don't mean to suggest here that they are wrong.

However, this conflict cannot, and will not, end  anytime soon because no one wants it to end. And I don't mean it in the sense of that no one is trying, but that the various incentives on both sides are towards disunity and conflict. As it stands, the central government is, shockingly, more stable with rebellion and militias running rampant than it would be without these armed factions to deal with due to rife factionalism within the government proper. The militias (on both sides, because while M23 and various anti-government militias do exist, there are at least as many pro-Kinshasa militias, which have the same incentive structure to perpetuate the conflict) have no incentive to end because of their various rackets, and both sides get so much money and assorted assistance from foreign support that any disruption to the status quo, sadly, would be far, far, more destabilizing to the country and region than this continued conflict.

videoList.comment_summary:
The YouTube comment section is discussing a Vice News documentary about the conflict in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC). The comments are a mix of reactions, insights, and opinions from viewers.

Many commenters express their sadness and concern for the people of the DRC, who have been suffering from conflict and poverty for decades. Some viewers share their personal connections to the region, such as having family members or friends who are from the DRC.

Some commenters praise the Vice News team for their bravery and quality journalism, highlighting the importance of reporting on under-covered stories. Others appreciate the documentary's nuanced and balanced approach to presenting the complexities of the conflict.

A few commenters point out the role of external factors, such as foreign support and the exploitation of the DRC's natural resources, in perpetuating the conflict. One commenter notes that the DRC's mineral wealth is valued at $35 trillion, yet the country remains one of the poorest in the world.

Some viewers also discuss the historical context of the conflict, including the legacy of colonialism and the impact of the Rwandan Civil War on the DRC. One commenter provides a detailed explanation of the complex history and politics of the region.

Several commenters express their support for the Congolese people and their desire for peace and stability in the region. One commenter notes that the conflict is not just a local issue, but also has implications for the entire African continent.

Overall, the comment section is a testament to the power of journalism to raise awareness and spark conversation about important global issues.
videoList.trans_summary:
The YouTube video discusses the ongoing conflict in the Eastern Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC), which has been plagued by war for 25 years. The conflict has resulted in over 6 million deaths, making it the deadliest global conflict since World War II. The current conflict is centered around the M23 Rebels, a group formed by the minority Tutsi ethnic group, who are fighting against the Congolese government.

The video highlights the role of neighboring countries, particularly Rwanda and Uganda, in fueling the conflict by backing proxy militias to extract minerals such as coltan and gold. Rwanda denies meddling in the DRC, but a leaked UN report confirms that Rwandan troops are supporting the M23 Rebels.

The video also features interviews with civilians, including Esperance, who has lost family members in previous conflicts and is now joining the fight against the M23 Rebels. Esperance believes that Rwanda is responsible for the conflict and that the Congolese government is not doing enough to protect its citizens.

The video also explores the role of the UN peacekeeping mission in the DRC, which has a billion-dollar annual budget but has been criticized for its ineffectiveness in protecting civilians. The video features footage of protests against the UN, which have turned deadly, with at least 29 civilians and four UN peacekeepers killed.

The video concludes by highlighting the frustration and anger of the Congolese people, who feel that the conflict is endless and that the international community is not doing enough to help. The video ends with a call to action, encouraging viewers to support Vice News' journalism and to consider making a contribution to help bring attention to the conflict in the DRC.

Key points:

* The conflict in the Eastern DRC has resulted in over 6 million deaths and has been ongoing for 25 years.
* The M23 Rebels are fighting against the Congolese government, with neighboring countries Rwanda and Uganda providing support.
* Rwanda denies meddling in the DRC, but a leaked UN report confirms that Rwandan troops are supporting the M23 Rebels.
* The UN peacekeeping mission in the DRC has a billion-dollar annual budget but has been criticized for its ineffectiveness in protecting civilians.
* Protests against the UN have turned deadly, with at least 29 civilians and four UN peacekeepers killed.
* The Congolese people are frustrated and angry about the endless conflict and feel that the international community is not doing enough to help.

videoList.transcript: I want to share with you a few tips on how to avoid taxes legally my name is Brian Kim my legal disclaimer is I am a certified public accountant so I'm a CPA I do encourage you to speak with your accountants if you don't have one then I hope you enjoy this free information before we begin I do have a request if I help you save money with this video then my request is that you enjoy the money treat yourself out help someone else out the way I see it I'm just happy that the money stays in your hands it's better than having the IRS have your money right if you're making under 400 000 a year this video is going to be perfect for you that's because the reason why I'm saying that is if you make over 400 000 a year then you can utilize more tax tricks there's more tricks that are available to you once you get over the one million dollar threshold that's when things start getting wacky there's a lot of gray areas but in today's video we're going to stick to information for people making under four hundred thousand dollars a year and I want to be upfront with you there is no magic bullet there's no secret hack that's gonna reduce your taxes to zero that privilege that's reserved for the billionaires with sophisticated offshore entities that's I'm just I'm basically saying that's it's not for people like you and me if you want to make your taxes go to zero without the offshore entities without the army of tax attorneys then the only way to pull that off is for you to go down the illegal routes so how to avoid taxes illegally if that's what you're looking for then you're at the wrong video you clicked on the video with the title that says how to avoid taxes legally therefore in this video I'm gonna I'm gonna show you how to do it legitimately so you can save money on your taxes and you can sleep well at night I'm basically going to teach you how to nickel and dime the IRS legally and those nickels and those nickels and dimes they're going to add up now let's begin let's start off with the easy ones number one is commuter benefits your workplace offers this to you so please take advantage for 2023 you can spend up to 300 a month tax-free on commuting so that's basically a 300 tax deduction every month which is three thousand six hundred dollars a year this is applicable to mass transit such as trains Subways buses ride sharing such as Uber or Lyft parking meters parking garages parking lots and more number two retirement plans so please take advantage of retirement Plans offered by your workplace for example a 401k or a 403 b retirement plan a 401k is offered by for-profit companies a 403 b is if you're working for certain governments or non-profit organizations so when you put money into your 401k or 403b you pay less taxes this year and you're building up your retirement accounts there are more retirement plans than just the 401K or 403b but these are just the more popular ones number three HSA and HSA is a health savings accounts for people with a high deductible Health Plan when you put money into your HSA it lowers your taxable income it's a tax deduction okay so here's how it works you put money into your HSA so you can think of the HSA like a savings accounts dedicated to health related expenses so if you spend the money on qualified medical expenses then you do not pay taxes on that money so essentially you're paying for your health related expenses with pre-tax money which is awesome Additionally you can invest the money in your HSA and the earnings and interest will be tax-free number four FSA and FSA is a flexible spending accounts and FSA allows you to pay for certain health care expenses with pre-tax money which is great but I do want to warn you that there's a use it or lose it rule with the FSA if you have leftover money in your FSA by the end of the year you end up losing it unless your company has a rollover option number five dependent care FSA you can pay for child care expenses with pre-tax money you can do this for children and adult dependents you can use your pre-tax money to pay for daycare nurseries preschool nannies Au pairs babysitters day camps after school programs Adult Day Care facilities and more now let's move on to saving money and paying less taxes within Investments so number six we have Capital losses if you have cryptocurrency losses make sure that you report them because losses are good for tax purposes losses are tax deductions so when it comes to stocks you will receive a tax form the 1099 B and your stock losses will be accounted for on that tax form so when it comes to stock losses they're pretty hard to overlook they're pretty hard to miss I'm bringing up cryptos specifically because in many instances you are not provided a year-end tax form and many people forget to report their crypto losses or many people are just too lazy to report them but you're throwing away money to the IRS if you don't number seven long-term capital gains if you hold on to a stock or a crypto for more than a year before selling it that is classified as a long-term capital gain long-term capital gains receive much better tax treatments the tax rate for long-term capital gains it's about half your regular tax rates and if you're under a certain income threshold you will qualify for a zero percent tax rate in that case you will pay zero taxes at the federal level your profits will be 100 tax free number eight review your 1099-b tax form the 1099-b is the year-end tax statement for your stock market activity so you get this tax form from your brokerage account like Robinhood or Ameritrade or whoever you use so they send this to you around late January to mid-February but you can also download the 1099b from your brokerage account you just have to go to the tax section in your app or on their website with this 1099 B tax form just gloss over it make sure that there are no obvious mistakes I want to tell you about the most common mistake that I see that makes people pay more tax than they should on your 109b tax form if you see some information that's blank or missing that could cost you a lot of money and I see this happen all the time your 1099-b says how much you bought a stock for and how much you sold it for if the how much you bought it for is missing you know for whatever reason then it looks like you bought it for zero dollars and then whatever you sold it for it looks like pure profits and then you're gonna erroneously end up paying a lot of taxes therefore look out for obvious errors like that number nine margin interest so please do not forget to deduct your margin interest you can deduct your investment interest expense and this is going to be listed on your 1099 B tax form as well I see so many people forgetting to report this because it's not listed on the cover page number 10 gambling losses so here's a random one that's actually useful because I see this quite frequently if you went to the casino and you won big on the slot machine then you will receive a tax form called a w2g we're not talking about a million dollar jackpot this is applicable if you win a few thousand dollars the casino sends a copy of your winnings to the IRS therefore if you don't report your winnings on your tax return then you will get in trouble however I want you to know that if you do get a w2g you can reduce that amount by how much money you lost gambling so the money that you lost on table games slots sports betting horse racing Etc you can use the losers to offset the winners number 11 traditional IRA so we spoke about the 401K and the 403 b those retirement plans are offered at your workplace the traditional IRAs a retirement plan that you set up outside of your work so depending on your situation you may qualify for a tax deduction for putting money into your traditional IRA so please keep that in mind number 12 529 plan if you want to put away money for Education whether it's for your child or for someone else or even for yourself you can put money into a 529 plan you will not receive a tax deduction with the IRS for funding a 529 plan however you may receive a tax deduction on your State's income taxes some states do not give a tax deduction for 529 plan contributions like California and nine states do not have state income taxes like Texas or Florida but even in those cases if you have a 529 plan you can still benefit from tax-free growth number 13 fix your W-4 payroll settings if you usually owe money to the IRS when you file your tax return in many cases you're getting charged an underpayment penalty and you don't even realize it's the penalty is listed on your tax return but many people overlook this because the penalty automatically adds to your balance due so it's Sneaky like that to prevent this you have to fix how much taxes that you have taken out of your paycheck you make that adjustment on your W-4 with your payroll departments or in your payroll settings so I made a video on how to do that I'll provide a link down below number 14 minimal rental use rule a lot of people have been listing their homes on Airbnb or similar providers if you rented out your home for 14 days or less the money that you make will be 100 tax free this is called the minimal rental use rule so make sure that you report this properly otherwise you're going to end up paying taxes which is wrong notify your accountants or look it up it's called again the minimal rental use rule so I hope this has been helpful to you I hope you pay less taxes to the IRS and again if this video helps save you money please treat yourself out treat someone else out I'm just happy for you please subscribe I thank you for the support and I wish you a very nice day

videoList.trans_summary:
The YouTube video, titled "How to Avoid Taxes Legally," is presented by Brian Kim, a certified public accountant (CPA). The video aims to provide tips and strategies for individuals making under $400,000 per year to minimize their tax liability legally.

Brian emphasizes that there is no "magic bullet" or "secret hack" to reduce taxes to zero without resorting to illegal means. He encourages viewers to consult with their accountants and to take advantage of legitimate tax deductions and credits.

The video covers 14 tips to help individuals save money on their taxes:

1. **Commuter benefits**: Take advantage of tax-free commuting expenses, up to $300 per month, to reduce taxable income.
2. **Retirement plans**: Contribute to 401(k), 403(b), or other retirement plans to lower taxable income and build retirement savings.
3. **Health Savings Account (HSA)**: Use an HSA to pay for qualified medical expenses with pre-tax dollars, reducing taxable income.
4. **Flexible Spending Account (FSA)**: Utilize an FSA to pay for healthcare expenses with pre-tax dollars, but be aware of the "use it or lose it" rule.
5. **Dependent care FSA**: Use a dependent care FSA to pay for child care or adult care expenses with pre-tax dollars.
6. **Capital losses**: Report capital losses, including cryptocurrency losses, to reduce taxable income.
7. **Long-term capital gains**: Hold onto investments for more than a year to qualify for more favorable tax rates.
8. **Review 1099-B tax form**: Ensure accuracy and completeness of the 1099-B tax form to avoid errors and underpayment penalties.
9. **Margin interest**: Deduct margin interest expenses to reduce taxable income.
10. **Gambling losses**: Report gambling losses to offset winnings and reduce taxable income.
11. **Traditional IRA**: Contribute to a traditional IRA to reduce taxable income, but be aware of income limits.
12. **529 plan**: Use a 529 plan to save for education expenses, potentially reducing state income taxes.
13. **Fix W-4 payroll settings**: Adjust W-4 settings to avoid underpayment penalties and ensure accurate tax withholding.
14. **Minimal rental use rule**: Take advantage of the minimal rental use rule to avoid taxes on short-term rentals (14 days or less).

Brian encourages viewers to consult with their accountants and to take advantage of these legitimate tax savings strategies to minimize their tax liability.

videoList.comment_summary:
The YouTube comment section is primarily discussing Indian politics, specifically the Bihar election and the prospects of Rahul Gandhi becoming the next Prime Minister of India. 

Many comments are expressing support for Rahul Gandhi and the Congress party, with some users even predicting his victory as the next Prime Minister. Some users are also discussing the potential impact of the Bihar election on the future of Indian politics.

There are also some comments expressing concerns about the fairness of the election process, with some users questioning the role of the Electronic Voting Machine (EVM) in the outcome of the election.

Additionally, some users are expressing support for other politicians, including Akhilesh Yadav and Nitish Kumar, while others are criticizing the BJP and RSS.

The tone of the comments is largely positive and supportive, with many users expressing enthusiasm for the prospects of a Congress-led government. However, there are also some negative comments and criticisms of the BJP and other politicians.

Some of the key themes and sentiments expressed in the comments include:

* Support for Rahul Gandhi and the Congress party
* Concerns about the fairness of the election process
* Criticism of the BJP and RSS
* Enthusiasm for the prospects of a Congress-led government
* Predictions of Rahul Gandhi's victory as the next Prime Minister

Overall, the comment section is a lively and engaging discussion of Indian politics, with many users sharing their opinions and perspectives on the latest developments.

* La comparaci√≥n de los precios de los servicios de tapicer√≠a en diferentes lugares, como Chihuahua y Puerto Rico.

videoList.trans_summary:
El video es sobre c√≥mo reparar un asiento de un autom√≥vil, espec√≠ficamente un asiento de una Chevy Silverado. El creador del video explica que no se requiere experiencia para realizar este tipo de reparaci√≥n y que cualquier persona con la actitud adecuada puede hacerlo.

El asiento en cuesti√≥n tiene una funda da√±ada y la espuma est√° desgastada. El creador del video muestra c√≥mo remover la funda vieja, que est√° pegada al metal del asiento, y c√≥mo despegar la espuma de la malla de alambre.

Luego, el creador del video muestra c√≥mo instalar la nueva funda y la espuma. Primero, se remueve la funda vieja y se despegan los pl√°sticos que est√°n pegados al metal. Luego, se coloca la nueva funda y se ajusta la espuma a la malla de alambre.

El creador del video tambi√©n muestra c√≥mo acomodar la funda a la forma del asiento, que puede ser un poco complicado debido a la forma curva del asiento. Para esto, se utilizan tornillos para asegurar la funda en su lugar.

Finalmente, el creador del video muestra c√≥mo conectar el switch que controla el movimiento del asiento. Tambi√©n ofrece consejos y recomendaciones para aquellos que deseen reparar su propio asiento de autom√≥vil.

El video es una gu√≠a detallada y paso a paso para reparar un asiento de autom√≥vil, y es √∫til para aquellos que deseen aprender a realizar esta tarea por s√≠ mismos.

videoList.comment_summary:
The YouTube comment section appears to be a discussion about programming and learning computer science. Here's a summary of the comments:

**Encouragement and Gratitude**: Many commenters express their gratitude for the creator's content and encourage them to continue creating videos. They also share their own experiences and goals related to programming.

**Programming Advice**: Some commenters ask for advice on which programming language to learn first, with some suggesting C++ as a good starting point. Others share their own experiences with different programming languages.

**Personal Stories**: A few commenters share their personal stories of how they got interested in programming and how they overcame challenges. They also express their appreciation for the creator's content and how it has helped them.

**Request for Specific Content**: Some commenters request specific content, such as a course on C# or a tutorial on how to learn programming in general.

**Technical Questions**: A few commenters ask technical questions, such as how to update a printer driver or how to learn a specific programming language.

**General Feedback**: Many commenters simply express their appreciation for the creator's content and offer general feedback on how to improve the videos.

**Language and Location**: The comments are written in Arabic, with some commenters mentioning their location (e.g., Morocco, Saudi Arabia, Germany).

**Age and Experience**: Some commenters mention their age and experience with programming, with a few commenters being high school students or beginners in the field.

**Overall Tone**: The overall tone of the comments is positive and supportive, with many commenters expressing their gratitude and enthusiasm for the creator's content.

Le vid√©o montre comment pr√©parer deux gigots d'agneau de Pauillac de mani√®re diff√©rente au barbecue. Les deux m√©thodes utilis√©es sont :

1. La premi√®re m√©thode consiste √† marquer les gigots d'agneau au camado (un type de barbecue) en les faisant passer sous les flammes pour obtenir un marquage uniforme. Ensuite, les gigots sont plac√©s dans la partie indirecte du barbecue pour cuire √† une temp√©rature de 180 degr√©s pendant environ 1 heure et quart.
2. La deuxi√®me m√©thode consiste √† faire cuire les gigots d'agneau dans une cocotte au barbecue. Les gigots sont marqu√©s au camado puis plac√©s dans la cocotte avec de l'huile d'olive, des herbes et des gousses d'ail. La cocotte est ensuite plac√©e dans la partie indirecte du barbecue pour cuire √† une temp√©rature de 180 degr√©s pendant environ 1 heure et quart.

Les deux m√©thodes donnent des r√©sultats similaires, avec des gigots d'agneau cuits √† point et d√©licieux. Le vid√©o montre √©galement comment utiliser une sonde pour v√©rifier la temp√©rature interne des gigots et comment ajuster la temp√©rature du barbecue pour obtenir les r√©sultats souhait√©s.

Le vid√©o est r√©alis√© par deux personnes, Laurent et Rafale, qui discutent et se commentent pendant la pr√©paration des gigots d'agneau. Ils partagent √©galement leurs exp√©riences et leurs conseils pour obtenir des r√©sultats parfaits. Le vid√©o est accompagn√© de musique et de commentaires humoristiques, ce qui rend la pr√©paration des gigots d'agneau amusante et engageante.

Die Kommentare sind √ºberwiegend positiv und begeistert von dem Honda Civic. Viele Kommentatoren haben bereits ein Honda-Civic-Modell besessen und sind von der Zuverl√§ssigkeit, Verarbeitung und Leistung des Autos √ºberzeugt. * Die Zuverl√§ssigkeit und Verarbeitung des Autos
* Die Leistung und Fahrspa√ü des Autos

Einige Kommentatoren haben auch ihre eigene Erfahrung mit anderen Honda-Modellen geteilt, wie dem CRX, dem Accord oder dem Type R. Einige haben auch ihre Meinung √ºber die Automobilindustrie in Deutschland ge√§u√üert und die Schwierigkeiten, ein Honda-Civic-Modell in Deutschland zu finden.

Insgesamt sind die Kommentare sehr positiv und begeistert von dem Honda Civic. Viele Kommentatoren haben ihre eigene Erfahrung mit dem Auto geteilt und ihre Meinung √ºber das Auto ge√§u√üert.
videoList.trans_summary:
Der YouTube-Video-Betreiber diskutiert √ºber den Honda Civic und warum er nicht sehr beliebt ist. Er gibt f√ºnf Gr√ºnde an, warum das Auto nicht sehr erfolgreich ist:

1. **Einschr√§nkungen in der Motorisierung**: Der Civic ist nur mit einem Vollhybrid-Antrieb erh√§ltlich, ohne reinen Benziner, reinen Diesel, milhybrid oder Plugin-Hybrid. Es gibt auch keine Option f√ºr Allradantrieb, au√üer dem Type R, der ein anderes Auto ist.

2. **Hoher Einstiegspreis**: Das Basismodell des Civic startet bei 38.900 ‚Ç¨, was f√ºr viele Kunden zu hoch ist. Der Golf, ein anderes beliebtes Auto, kostet dagegen unter 30.000 ‚Ç¨.

3. **Geringe Zuladung**: Der Civic kann nur 397 kg zuladen, was relativ schnell erreicht wird, wenn man 5 Personen und ein bisschen Gep√§ck mitnimmt. Die Dachlast betr√§gt 65 kg, und die Anh√§ngelast ist auf 750 kg begrenzt, ungebremst.

4. **Platzangebot**: Der Civic hat ein gutes Platzangebot hinten, aber beim Kofferraum ist die Abfallende Dachlinie st√∂rend, wenn man h√∂her stapeln m√∂chte.

5. **Schwache Marke**: Honda ist in Deutschland nicht mehr so beliebt wie vor 20 Jahren, als es noch 37.000 j√§hrliche Neuzulassungen gab. Heute sind es nur noch 6.519.

Der Video-Betreiber gibt jedoch auch f√ºnf Gr√ºnde an, warum der Civic trotzdem ein gutes Auto ist:

1. **Einfache Bedienung**: Der Civic hat eine einfache Bedienung, mit echten Kn√∂pfen und Tasten, anstatt Touch-Screens.

2. **Sparsamkeit**: Der Civic ist sparsam, mit einem WLTP-Verbrauch von 5 l, der sehr nahe an der Realit√§t liegt.

3. **Antriebsstrang**: Der Antriebsstrang des Civic ist fantastisch, mit einem CVT-Getriebe, das sich sehr gut anpasst.

4. **Ausstattung**: Der Civic hat viel Ausstattung, einschlie√ülich 11 Airbags, Honda Connect mit Navigation, R√ºckfahrkamera und mehr.

5. **Sportmodell**: Das Sportmodell des Civic hat einen Handschalter, der f√ºr viele Kunden ein Highlight ist.

Der Video-Betreiber empfiehlt, dass mehr Leute Probefahrten mit dem Civic machen sollten, um zu sehen, wie gut es ist. Er nennt den VW Golf, den Hyundai i30 und den Opel Astra als Alternativen, aber meint, dass der Civic besser ist.

videoList.comment_summary:
The YouTube comment section appears to be discussing a legendary interview between Ninja Man and Emily Crooks. The comments are overwhelmingly positive, with many users expressing their admiration for Ninja Man's intelligence, wit, and authenticity. 

Several users mention that the interview never gets old and that they have watched it multiple times, with some claiming to have watched it over 50 times. Many users praise Ninja Man's ability to think on his feet and respond to questions with clever and humorous remarks.

Some users also appreciate Emily Crooks' interviewing skills, acknowledging that it's not easy to interview someone as intelligent and charismatic as Ninja Man. A few users mention that they have met Ninja Man in person and that he is just as authentic and down-to-earth as he appears in the interview.

The comments also reveal a strong sense of community and shared enthusiasm for Ninja Man's music and personality. Many users express their love for the artist and his music, with some even claiming that he is one of the greatest reggae and dancehall artists Jamaica has ever produced.

Overall, the comment section is a testament to the enduring popularity and influence of Ninja Man and his iconic interview with Emily Crooks.
videoList.trans_summary:
The YouTube video is an interview with Ninja Man, a Jamaican musician, on the show "Exposure" hosted by Emily Crooks. The interview takes place after Ninja Man's performance at the Sting festival in December. 

Ninja Man, whose real name is Desmond Ballentine, is asked about his performance at Sting, where he handed over an illegal gun to the police. He claims it was a spontaneous action, but also mentions that he has a gun for protection in Jamaica, where he feels it's necessary due to his background and the country's social issues.

The conversation turns to his personal life, including his 23 children with 22 different women. Ninja Man defends his actions, saying that he believes children are a blessing from God and that abortion is wrong. He also claims that he takes care of his children, but Emily Crooks questions this, suggesting that it's a worthless mentality to have multiple children without being able to provide for them.

The interview also touches on Ninja Man's past, including his childhood and how he grew up in a rough neighborhood. He mentions that he started working at a young age, selling mangoes and other items on the street, and that he had to fend for himself from a young age.

The interview ends with a break, with Emily Crooks promising to continue the conversation with Ninja Man after the break.
